website_summaries.verdict: An entry-level model from a company renowned for its blade quality. Does not have the deep serrations of others on our shortlist, but it's a versatile utility player for a number of food prep tasks.
pros: Affordable price point from a well-respected brand
Good for processing hard vegetables and fruits
Fine edge can be restored with sharpening steel
cons: Blade length on the short side for a bread knife
Metal blade bends easily under side pressure

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Fine about this Fine Edge Knife!
customer_reviews.text: So unhappy with this knife for many reasons. First of all, a Henckels knife made in Taiwan? That by itself was a major disappointment. Next, the knife appeared to have been used, or at least a damaged product as the handle was scratched quite a bit. Although that would not take away from performance, I certainly don't want to spend money on an item with damage. Lastly, it does not cut the way expected, and certainly not the quality of a Henckels knife. Although the price was reasonable, it sure makes me realize the old adage, "You Get What You Pay For" is definitely true!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: low quality with visible steel imperfections
customer_reviews.text: There were days when Henckel’s knives used to be good quality, but those days are long gone, and manufacturing facilities moved far away from EU countries. This one is made in Thailand and steel has clearly visible markings and imperfections. My old KitchenAid knife i bought for 1/3 of the price looks like a superior masterpiece in comparison to this one.
customer_reviews.author: TO Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I love this bread knife
customer_reviews.text: We have a bread bakery, and people ask about a "good" bread knife. They're not looking for a high ticket item, but something affordable and good quality. This is it. I've used a lot of different ones, but I could make a strong case that this is the best one for a home kitchen, based on the quality, feel, blade, and price. You can't go wrong with this one, unless you want something longer, which I've not found to ever be necessary...and I prefer a 12" chefs knife too, so that's something.
customer_reviews.author: A. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews and have found the knife delivered to me to be just as I wanted and expected. And, does it cut! I wavered over whether to buy the $49 or so version, or this one. I'm glad I gave it a try. It has done very well.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Faith AdairTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: With all the reviews thought this one would be a nice cheap solution
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an auxiliary travel bread knife so I always have one at home. With all the reviews thought this one would be a nice cheap solution. What a joke. This knife has no sharpness whatsoever. My other bread knife was only twenty bucks, should have just gotten a second one of those, it has absolutely no challenge cutting. We're talking fresh bread, not stale, and this knife just fails to get a grip, forcing you to smash the bread. I do not understand how this has 4.5 stars. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Adams

customer_reviews.title: Durability is very weak.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product three months ago. By the way, about a month ago, a little rust and it is in the current. Durability is very weak. I sent an email to the seller but they just asked to contact the mfg customer center. I contacted the mfg customer center but only heard an auto voice. I never recommend this manufacturer, seller, and J.A. Henckel brand. Except my old kitchen knife set by German Henckel.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: A great deal at the price
customer_reviews.text: A decent knife for slicing my homemade crusty bread. The blade is not flimsy at all and does not bend when slicing the bread. Fits right ion my knife block. A great deal at the price. I do wish it was German made, which I assume from the brand.
customer_reviews.author: R. Romero

customer_reviews.title: and would squeeze the bread a bit more than I liked. This knife has been great
customer_reviews.text: Had a 6" bread knife before, but had smaller teeth, and would squeeze the bread a bit more than I liked. This knife has been great! slices smooth through Italian, and French bread as if it was butter.
customer_reviews.author: JOE SIMS

customer_reviews.title: Great bread knife
customer_reviews.text: Great bread knife for right handed people who hold the bread in their left hand and cut with the knife in their right hand. Blade cuts straight and easy. I have purchased two of these. I purchased one for myself several years ago and now I purchased another for my mom.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying this knife. The first one accidentally got dropped behind the oven and couldn't be retrieved. We tried to see if we could do without a bread knife. Nope. This bread knife makes it onto the list of items I cannot live without. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good weight . Good value. Holds an edge. smallish handle. Good buy
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Hymer

customer_reviews.title: Really solid knife
customer_reviews.text: Not the sharpest bread knife I've ever used but it gets the job done, is easy to clean, and I haven't had any rust troubles. Handle is a good shape and size.
customer_reviews.author: NCAA FB coach

customer_reviews.title: The knife is very well made. * One note ...
customer_reviews.text: The knife is very well made. * One note is that I wish I had purchased a longer knife as I mainly make round bread in a Dutch oven. So, if you are looking to have one bread knife I would get a longer one, I will have to replace this at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Nice and sharp. My set is a higher quality Henckels, but I haven't noticed a discernible difference in the performance level of this knife in comparison to the $50 version. Very happy with it. It tackles the incredibly hard-crusted sourdough that my hubby loves for breakfast with ease, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Faye Powell

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality knife
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this knife to add on to my collection of J.A Henckels knives I already have. Does the job well but noticed that this one didn’t say German steel on it like the others I purchased in the past.
customer_reviews.author: PEGGY

customer_reviews.title: Nice craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: We had gone so long with out a bread knife! So glad we made this purchase. We love it. We also use it to cut tomatoes - great knife!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dull, struggles to cut through a crusty loaf
customer_reviews.text: Overall quite unimpressed with this knife, does not seem sharp enough at all. I got a crusty ciabatta loaf and it struggles to break the crust. Not much more to say than that, it's just not a very good bread knife.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This knife really cuts well! The serrated edge cuts through the toughest bread without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: RickH

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife...
customer_reviews.text: A good knife. Great for splitting english muffins that don't seems to get cut through. i also use it to cut sausage patties from the tubes. Doesa good job. I have not sharpened it yet, but I do have a JA Henckel knife sharpener that work great, so I am not concerned
customer_reviews.author: Sayya2daUPeh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality at a breathtakingly low price
customer_reviews.text: Henckels "International" line is identical to their regular knives--but it's made in China. It's made very well too, and unless you looked at the fine print, you wouldn't realize that it wasn't made in Germany. The bread knife is a bit shorter than we are used to in the States, but it works well for crusty baguettes and Italian bread. An excellent way to build up your knife collection with a quality product at a bargain price.
customer_reviews.author: David Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I used to think I had a bread knife until I got this bad boy. Really nice weight and very sturdy. As is usual with this brand, I'm sure it'll last me a very, very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brent9286

customer_reviews.title: Not made in Germany
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled. This knife is not made in Germany and is not sharp. I ended putting in my utility room and bought another one made in Germany and what a difference in sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this bread knife in hopes of learning to be a surgeon on a budget
customer_reviews.text: After cutting my hands many times I must say this knife is terrible for DIY surgery. But it’s a heack of a bread knife so Ill just use it for that I guess...
customer_reviews.author: JHW

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME knife!
customer_reviews.text: These Henckel knives are really wonderful. Great price on this one too!
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Yonckheere

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent bread knife and I was blown away by the price. The size and sharpness is perfect for cutting crusty bread. We love fresh loafs of sour dough which has a firm crust and this slices it perfectly and doesn't tear up the bread.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: If I had tons of money I would have a kitched equiped like a fine chef. However being one of the 98% that doesn't happen here. The price was right and the knife is great. Would of course buy any J.A. Henckels knife again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT quality & reasonably priced bread knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for myself 2 months ago and my niece wanted one so bought it for her on Amazon. Excellent quality - tho I have to admit I was bummed when I saw it was made in China. Most likely why the price was so reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: Good enough but a cheaper one would do just as good a job.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a perfectly good knife and well made, but probably a little pricier that the job warrants.
customer_reviews.author: katydid

customer_reviews.title: but I recommend spending the money for the German made
customer_reviews.text: This knife is OK , but I recommend spending the money for the German made product
customer_reviews.author: lillie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap yet works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife it cuts through bread like butter . We like to purchase bakery bread and it lasts significantly longer if it's not presliced. Would reorder in a heartbeat the price can't be beat! My 9 year old daughter uses it with ease she calls it the best knife ever.
customer_reviews.author: AK_Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Lovely blade, nice balance
customer_reviews.text: I chose this knife after reviewing dozens of bread knives and finally took a chance because of the great price. I was not disappointed. It slices velvety cake or airy artisanal breads without crushing. My only advice is that if too much crumb sticks to the blade, then the bread is too hot to cut. But, hey, who doesn't want bread hot from the oven?
customer_reviews.author: NT

customer_reviews.title: Won't cut will crush
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box and it crushes bread instead of what it's intended to do.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Harcourt

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like the knife at all the handle is worst poor quality the blade alignment was also not proper for 1 of the 3 knife I put that in trash didn't expect this from J A Henkells Disappointed..
customer_reviews.author: Akshay More

customer_reviews.title: Cutting not good as they use to be.
customer_reviews.text: Henkle knifes do not seem to be as good as they were in the past. I have ones that are older and they are heavier and cut better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again:  sharp, well-balanced, well-made
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, well-balanced, nice serration, handle survives the dishwasher with no problems. I'd get again.
customer_reviews.author: VonWandurer

customer_reviews.title: Almost impossible to open the packaging.
customer_reviews.text: The knife is ok just from the looks. But the package is EXTREMLY HARD to open. I almost cut myself and was able to take the knife out only after completely destroying the package. Be prepared. I haven't really used the knife yet, but it looks fine.
customer_reviews.author: chen

customer_reviews.title: A good knife.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made knife and looks and feels it. First of all there is nothing like stainless steel for a blade. And the handle is classic professional kitchen cutlery. I like this on better than the carbon steel that I had bought at an earlier time. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. O

customer_reviews.title: After a couple of years of use... ...
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of years of use...handle came apart. the back part broke off. I feel these should last forever. .. a bit dissapointing ...but was only 20bucks...but still
customer_reviews.author: L. Cedeno Villalba

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Useful
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great knife for the price. Sharp, well balance in the hand. Cuts bread, rolls, etc very easily. I bought based on the prior reviews. Replaced two so-so knives with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Diane F Bufter

customer_reviews.title: Horrible packaging but the knife works well
customer_reviews.text: Great knife but the packaging sucks. You need to be a ninja and have sharp scissors to get in, for that single reason I wouldn’t buy it again. I do like how it cuts my bread though!
customer_reviews.author: Grant G.

customer_reviews.title: great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: great product at a great price with quick delivery. What else could one ask for?
customer_reviews.author: R. Jerome

customer_reviews.title: Good Henckle addition
customer_reviews.text: needed a good knife to slice bread and use to cut up the upcoming Tritip when BBQ season warms up again...SO looking forward to trying it..have already used it Nicely on Hubbys banana bread as well as mine..gives a wonderful cut..hightly recomend it
customer_reviews.author: LLA

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Handy
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, Sharp, Sharp. Great for cutting meats and breads! Haven't had it that long so I am not sure how long it will last. I only hand wash it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Sharper n' my wife Tonyas tung... and ...
customer_reviews.text: Sharper n' my wife Tonyas tung...and she damn near lost all four of her other fingers it in the process of cutting the kernels off the cob to make her famous sautéed corn... Done em up ina big old cast-iron skillet....mmmmMMMMMM!!
customer_reviews.author: Chas

customer_reviews.title: Please pass the bread
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm for cutting. I recievea breadmaker sometime back, and loved it. But when I would use a regular knife to divy out pieces, the bread would end up smooshed. My only gripe is that it rusted after about 6 washings. It cost so little, and it still works, so it is small complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Kamp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent knife
customer_reviews.text: We have yet t be disappointed with any Henckels products. We even have a big set of their flatware, along with our beloved knives. I'd recommend them to anyone who wants a nicely balanced, high quality knife.
customer_reviews.author: Tattercat

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, great price
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts when I paid only [price] for a Henckels knife that it would actually be a decent piece of cutlery. No need to worry! This is a great knife. It is sturdy, it keeps its edge, and it looks great with my other Henckels knives. This is by far the best bread knife I've ever used. I'm very pleased with the quality, and I'm glad I took a chance on ordering it.
customer_reviews.author: mellion108

customer_reviews.title: Great knives but it's not made in Germany
customer_reviews.text: Great knives but it's not made in Germany, one is better off getting it from the store like Bed, Bath, and Beyond in which you can see where it was made at.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Angel

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great bread knife. Cuts smoothly and very well made. Should last many many years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful knives, well made and balanced. It pays to buy good knives.
customer_reviews.author: FDGUY1970

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for bread and tomatoes. It will slice through warm loaf without destroying it.
customer_reviews.author: Tenedora

customer_reviews.title: Great Knives!
customer_reviews.text: These knives stay sharp forever and they are a good price!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The fine edge makes it perfect for cutting Italian bread without crushing the loaf.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: It's fine for my occasional use
customer_reviews.text: You can immediately tell the difference in construction between this knife and its German cousins..this one is made in Thailand. It is fine for me, though, and I am satisfied with it.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really great for breads and well worth this minimal privce!
customer_reviews.author: HERDMAN

customer_reviews.title: Good knife
customer_reviews.text: while this knife is a good buy it was far too large for our needs was returned for a J.A Henckels intl 5 " serrated and works just fine for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dee6978

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and easily cut through my hard crusty artisan bread. Like the butter spread end also.
customer_reviews.author: Celt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent knife. I liked it so much I ordered a set of Henckel knives!
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Sandwiches
customer_reviews.text: For the price it works great, I run it through thick crusted French bread and the slices are clean.
customer_reviews.author: RONALD R. SAMBRANO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great on bread & other items like tomatoes. Highly recommend...will last forever.

customer_reviews.title: Good bread knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Henckels bread knife in 2002 and it's still my favorite bread knife. I have no trouble slicing through bread with it. It feels solid in the hand and it's as lovely now as it was back when it was new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Knife works great, been using it for tomatoes and bread with no difficulty and easy to clean.

customer_reviews.title: knife
customer_reviews.text: Had one for ourselves for several years, great knife and great price. purchased one for our daughter who loves it as well.

customer_reviews.title: A nice bread knife!
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice bread knife. I actually use it a lot and it's holding up very well.

customer_reviews.title: A must have for bread lovers
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp, cuts bread perfectly. A must have in the kitchen if you eat and bake bread.
customer_reviews.author: Aracely Suto

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife At A Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Great knife! This was one more to help and fill my current collection.
customer_reviews.author: John Briney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes cutting crusty bread/baguettes much easier than the old serrated blade knife I'd been using.
customer_reviews.author: Cobra

customer_reviews.title: No problems with quality like other buyers have had
customer_reviews.text: Too short to be practical but a very sharp and well made knife. No problems with quality like other buyers have had.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great Bread knife
customer_reviews.text: Large serrated break knife has worked great with every loaf we have tried it on. I have not tried it on anything else so i cannot speak for its versatility.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bread Knife!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new bread knife! It is sooo sharp, slices right through crusty bread without smashing it down.

customer_reviews.title: lovely knife
customer_reviews.text: Really like this knife--does a great job with the breads, which is what i wanted it for.

customer_reviews.title: For the price you can't beat it. It's not ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat it. It's not the sharpest blade and the handle feels a little weird but it gets the job done.

customer_reviews.title: great bargain for the price
customer_reviews.text: This knife works very well with hot homemade bread. For the price it is an excellent bargain.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good knife - good price. Very good for cutting bread.

customer_reviews.title: it cut bread!
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is expected to do. the Handle is great and fit perfectly on a big hand!

customer_reviews.title: Henckels is great. Always get the German made
customer_reviews.text: Henckels is great. Always get the German made, not the Chinese version.

customer_reviews.title: Bread Knife
customer_reviews.text: JA Henckel products are the best and this one is no exception. I have the perfect place for it in my butcher's block.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp as hell
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good knife. incredibly sharp, great for cutting fresh hot bread without smashing it. Amazing quality from a very well known brand.

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest high quality knife you'll find
customer_reviews.text: For a price just south of $..., you really can't beat this knife. It could be a bit longer, but it gets the job done in style. It looks great, feels solid and just has an all around feel of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tomatoes!
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is a bread knife, I bought it to cut tomatoes. It's very light and extremely sharp. It cuts smoothly through tomatoes or bread or anything that is squishy with a tough skin. At first I thought the knife had a small defect, but it ended up being a leftover scrap from when the blade was stamped (I assume). It easily came off and the blade is now flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Shorter15

customer_reviews.title: Great bread knife
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for myself and one for my son. We agree-it is a great bread knife. Good price also. Would purchase again.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bread Knife!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good easy to use bread knife, I really enjoy using it on a regular basis.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bread Knife
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful knife. This blade is well balanced and has a really secure feel. I'm glad I bought it

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great knife, not too long (perfect for a smaller kitchen), sharp out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: ivp76

customer_reviews.title: woking fine
customer_reviews.text: I use this knife to cut bagels frequently. This knife works fine. I don't see any problem. It is a good purchase with an inexpensive price. I bought this knife to fill the Twin Pro "S" Block knife set.

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Quality
customer_reviews.text: This knive works perfectly for slicing breads, cakes & other flour products, could not find a single fault with it.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This knife matched the rest of my Henkels and fit in the knife block perfectly. It is great for cutting any kind of bread.
customer_reviews.author: jami blake

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous bread knife at an incredibly good price. Easy to hold and cuts quite well - everyone should have one!
customer_reviews.author: Josh DeLott

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: I took it out from the box the second it arrived. I was looking forward to using this knife to cut my bread but it is not any better than the knife I already have. I returned it the next day.
customer_reviews.author: rmisasa

customer_reviews.title: it's a bread knife and it works...that's all
customer_reviews.text: no complaints, no praises...other than it cuts bread. When I shopped, this seemed like the best priced bread knife. It works perfectly, but if there's cheaper out there...unless you're set on the looks of this one, get the cheaper one. They're bread knives - they have to be very good to do what they're supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Somebody may be enjoying it
customer_reviews.text: It looked great. Unfortunately I went abroad, put it on checked luggage and it never reached destination. It just dissapeared.
customer_reviews.author: LE

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: someone plz suggest me a better knife. this one is pathetic. stopped working after 3 months of use. !!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Zaman

customer_reviews.title: Good breadknife, very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Good breadknife, very sharp. Cuts through tomatoes with no crushing whatsoever and of course is good with bread too.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: As advertised great price what can I add its a Hinckel.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate knife  for bread & tomatoes
customer_reviews.text: Great for bread & tomatoes cuts easy & straight EZ to keep clean
customer_reviews.author: C. A. II

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The upside is too coarse. So my wife had wound her fingers
customer_reviews.author: JIN CHOUL CHAI

customer_reviews.title: Returned to amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I got what I paid for ($15). Perhaps I should have known better, but I figured that since Henckels is one of better known brands maybe I was just getting a good deal. This knife is made by stamping the shape out of a piece of metal with a template. This is a cheaper way to make knives compared to forging. The serration points were all bent and dull and in between the points there was excess metal from where it was stamped out.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: don't but 8 inch. should you get 12 inch ...
customer_reviews.text: don't but 8 inch. should you get 12 inch no matter what. 8 inch just the same of the bread and you need room(longer) when you cut your bread.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Wu

customer_reviews.title: The quality control for this knife is a problem. ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality control for this knife is a problem. I gave it as a gift and that person cut themselves on the top portion of the knife. The manufacturer neglected to file down the edges on the top of the knife and if your hand slips while cutting, you can cut yourself on that sharp metal edge of the knife.
customer_reviews.author: paintaneight

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: It is safe to say that I was ecstatic when I saw a Henckel serrated knife for under $20. I figured that it would not be a stellar blade, but that given the name stamped on it that it would be "good." Well I can say as a connoisseur of cooking and fine cutlery that this knife is cheap! The edge on it brand new was poor. It should be cutting through bread like butter, but I actually need to use significant pressure when I cut through a baguette...which is not good. I will attempt to take it to get sharpened, but I am not going to get my hopes up.
customer_reviews.author: chicobeau

product_meta.title: HENCKELS Fine Edge Pro Bread Knife, 8-inch, Black/Stainless Steel
product_meta.description:
J.A. Henckels International Paring Knives are perfectly designed for smaller kitchen tasks such as peeling or coring vegetables and fruits. 3-pc set includes: 3.5-inch paring knife, 3-inch vegetable knife and a 2-inch peeling knife. Lifetime limited manufacturer warranty. Dishwasher safe.

AMAZON.COM
A crusty loaf yields easily to this knife, whose serrations are big enough to rate--in knife-speak--as "scallops." Henckels' International Fine Edge is an inexpensive cutlery line made in countries other than the company's home of Germany. These knives don't have bolsters and their blades are thinner and less strong. Handles are narrower and shallower than those of the company's premier lines--a feature those with small hands might appreciate. --Fred Brack
feature_bullets: The serrated blade will cut through the hardest bread crust or delicately slice through a tomato
Fine Edge Pro knives offer stamped high-carbon German stainless steel blades
Stamped blade made of high-quality German stainless steel
Black, satin-finished polypropylene handle with triple-rivet construction
Fully visible tang construction provides proper balance
Handwash with mild cleanser; lifetime warranty
